p: The relative fitness of Î»cI857 was calculated as W = ( f t /(1- f t))/ ( f 0 /(1- f 0)) where f t measures the frequency at time t. In general the frequency was calculated over the whole host population. In Fig 6 we distinguish horizontal fitness, W H, and vertical fitness, W V, by focusing either on the frequency in newly infected bacteria (bacteria carrying the plasmid pRSET-mCherry) or on the frequency in previously infected bacteria (bacteria that do not carry the plasmid pRSET-mCherry), respectively. In Fig 4 we present the ratio W H / W V for different mixing treatments.
